qas.question: What are examples of differentiated effector cells that peak during wake periods?

answers.text: cytotoxic natural killer cells and CTLs (cytotoxic T lymphocytes)
cytotoxic natural killer cells and CTLs
cytotoxic natural killer cells and CTLs (cytotoxic T lymphocytes)

qas.question: What are two anti-inflammatory molecules that peak during awake hours?
Inflammation occurs during sleep times because of the presence of what molecule?
Melatonin during sleep can actively counteract the production of what?
What cells are at their lowest while people are awake?

plausible_answers.text: to elicit an effective response against any intruding pathogens

qas.question: Why do differentiated effector cells ebb during wake periods?
What molecules that promote inflammation peak during waking hours?

plausible_answers.text: cause serious cognitive and physical impairments

qas.question: What could inflammation do during sleep periods?
What could promote free radical production during sleep times?
